Posts.Content: yellowdoglady wrote: I am a TNBC survivor myself, and I thought I had seen and felt most all of the stuff I could.  Tonight I heard that my stepsis had passed and I couldn't even breathe.  She was Stage IV for seven years, maybe eight.  So strong.  So wonderful.  So supportive.  I don't even know what to feel right now except such a huge loss.  Bigger than huge. When all you want is a hug from the person you have lost just to know it isn't real, well you are in a bit of trouble now. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: So Freaking Sad yellowdoglady karen333

Posts.Content: yellowdoglady wrote: I just lost my stepsis and she was incredible.  But she had one of those BC genes, and never knew about it.  She was adopted and had no idea about her medical history before she got sick.   I will love her forever.  She should be here and sadly is not.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am TNBC, my sissie was not. yellowdoglady MCTHO
